intro: Noronhia ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaranensis Noronhia, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within humid forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
